column5: Correction, NOT BOLTON! These guys screwed me and several other people I have met.
ANY INPUT ON KISSISSING LAKE LODGE OUT OF FLIN FLON?
For the amount of cash it costs and the fishing you'll get your far better off at other places + Ikes kinda of a jerk
I was there maybe ten years ago. Nice trip. 5-star, They took good care of us. gentleman's trip.

I agree. I've been there and I'd go elsewhere. Like a lot of drive-in lakes, it's a great lake that's seen better days. Ike will tell you tales a m---i---l---e long. I will say that they do have some good flyouts, though.They seem to have a lot of problems with guide turnover, too. The good guides go to longtime customers.
i am not familar with "ike" i have been communicating with curt and juanita ennis. is this the same outfit
any suggestions on fly-in only out of flin flon?

There is only one "Kississing Lake Lodge" Ike owns it and Reed Lake Lodge......his son has been running the lodge on kississing and is cut from the same mold as daddy............what are you fishing for .....lot better options out there for the same money!!!!!!
my son and i are interested in a fly-in for northern, lake trout,ect.main focus on northern.. any suggestions? want guided.thx
Gods Lake, Bolten Lake, Hatchet, Reindeer, Nultin, Wollastonany would be better that kississing ...not that much more and ten times the fishing.......

You don't need to fly in for big Pike,i guess if you can afford it but there is great lakes small and large that hold alot of trophy fish that you can drive too.I live in Northern Manitoba and fish alot.Reed lake is a great lake to fish at for all species.I go there mainly for the Lake trout.Its only 3 hours from my house.We have caught trophy pike there walleye's and lakers,the pike there are huge.Very nice campground and 2 lodges one is located beside the campground and the other on fourmile island minutes away from the boat launch.they have flyins from the lodges also.Tramping lake is another Lake close to Reed they are joined by the Grassy river system.This lake holds the same species of fish as Reed but more known for the big walleye's and Pike.Plus there are also many other lakes around this area that have awesome walleye fishing.FISH ON.
